title: Engineering Manager, Core Infrastructure
content:
Who we are

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companiesâ€”from the worldâ€™s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startupsâ€”use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyoneâ€™s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Compute is making it easy and safe for Stripe engineers to change their operating systems, giving them a high-quality base system and the tools to modify it safely. The team owns Stripe-wide OS lifecycle and tooling. The team is expanding scope to tackle Linux kernel projects, MicroVMs, OS management, and security at mass scale. We are also researching new generation operating systems like BottleRocket.
What youâ€™ll do
Responsibilities
Develop engineers on the team, helping them advance in their careers
Enable Operating Systems to empower Stripe engineers to succeed by:
Understanding what a high-quality developer experience works like
Collecting and analyzing data to inform the teamâ€™s approach
Talking to our customers and learning about their challenges, and
Guiding your team to deliver the right results
Understand how low-level system details (such as kernel and OS versions, parameters, configuration, and code) impact the correctness, efficiency, security, and performance of Stripeâ€™s production workloads
Hire and grow Stripes to build a team of engineers
Who you are
Weâ€™re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
3+ years of engineering management experience
4+ years of software development experience 
2+ years of cloud development or management experience
Experience using in-depth knowledge of operating systems to solve technical problems
Detailed technical knowledge of Linux performance and security
Experience running highly efficient teams
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing remote and distributed teams
Experience working closely across geographies, and managing a team where important partners are many timezones away
Familiarity with managing a large fleet of Linux servers, Linux package management and distribution, and/or deploying and coordinating Linux updates at scale

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
